subject: Re: [junit] .AssertionFailedError
msgSnippet: First of all, check the FAQ :) Second, do a search on the forum. Aside from that, I ll guess the name of your test method doesn t start with test . -Eric ...
messageBody:
First of all, check the FAQ :)
Second, do a search on the forum.

Aside from that, I'll guess the name of your test
method doesn't start with 'test'.

-Eric

--- smatalonga <smatalonga@...> wrote:
> Hi, I'm new to the groups and to JUnit.
>
> I've been reading the FAQ and the message archive
> but could not find
> an answer for my problem.
>
> I hava a methad which throws an Exception.
>
> I've made a test which follows the recomendation of
> the fact.
>
> try{
> int invalidInt = -1;
> MyClass c = new myClass(invalidInt);
> fail("Should've thrown MyCLassException");
> }
> catch(MyClassException mce){}
> catch(Exception e)
> {
> fail("Should never throw exception other than
> MyClassException");
> }
>
> SO far so good, but when I run the test I get:
> "
> There was 1 failure:
>
> 1) warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: No tests found
> in
> obligatorio.CartaTest
>
>
>
> FAILURES!!!
>
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
> "
>
> I'm working with Jbuilder 6.
>
> Thanks, And I apologiice If this issue has already
> been answered.
> Mata
>
>
>
